intro: Koanophyllon triradiatum, commonly known as the three-rayed blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, showing adaptability to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are small and blue or purple in color. Koanophyllon triradiatum is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and as a component of local plant communities.
